item.title: The Clever D Block Initiative
item.description:
During the recent 700 MHz spectrum auction, a small frequency band known as D Block went unsold because it didn’t reach its reserve price. This is unfortunate because D Block was supposed to play a crucial role in establishing a nationwide public service network. This plan, which could serve as a model for other initiatives, deserves further consideration, especially in challenging economic times. The idea for D Block originated after the September 11, 2001, attacks, when communication breakdowns hampered rescue efforts...

item.title: Get Your Business Bandwidth Free
item.description:
Telecommunication expenses are a considerable cost for businesses, but there are ways to reduce them significantly. Beyond switching providers, you can eliminate your bandwidth costs entirely through a real estate model. Imagine renting an apartment where the rent from other units covers your mortgage, allowing you to live there for free. This principle applies to internet connections as well. You can become your own service provider by ordering a service and router, then leasing out the bandwidth to neighboring businesses...
